contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whatever has happened before is what will happen again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: whatever has been done is what will be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "about which someone may say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: about which it may be said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will not likely remember them either" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will not likely be remembered either

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that people do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the deeds that are done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People cannot straighten things that are twisted! They cannot count what is not there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The twisted cannot be straightened! The missing cannot be counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "forest where trees grew" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: forest where trees were grown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People do not remember the wise man for very long, just as they do not remember the fool for very long" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For the wise man, like the fool, is not remembered for very long

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will have long forgotten everything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything will have been long forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the work that people do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the work done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one can add anything to or take anything away from it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Nothing can be added to it or taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone can overpower a person who is alone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: One man alone can be overpowered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people cannot easily break a rope made with three strands" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a three-strand rope is not quickly broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people oppressing the poor and robbing them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the poor being oppressed and robbed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "an owner hoards riches" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: riches hoarded by the owner

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "no one buries him at all" or 2) he receives no honor, "no one buries him properly." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] or [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: he is not buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he does not satisfy his appetite" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his appetite is not satisfied

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People have already named everything that exists" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whatever has existed has already been given its name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people already know what mankind is like" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: what mankind is like has already been known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The more words that people speak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The more words that are spoken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that people say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every word that is spoken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she will capture the sinner" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the sinner will be taken by her

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "changes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is changed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "No army discharges anyone" or "No army allows soldiers to leave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No one is discharged from the army

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "every kind of work that people do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: every kind of work that is done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Evil people that died were given honorable burials. Alternate translation: "people bury the wicked publicly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the wicked buried publicly

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People took them from the holy area and buried them and praised them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were taken from the holy area and buried and were praised by people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When people in authority do not quickly execute a sentence against an evil crime" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When a sentence against an evil crime is not executed quickly

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will not prolong his life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his life will not be prolonged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "something else that people do on the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: something else that is done on the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the work that people do on the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the work that is done on the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) "the work that God does under the sun" or 2) "the work that God allows people to do under the sun." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the work that is done under the sun

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that happens" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything that is done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will forget them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their memory is forgotten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "anything that people do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: anything done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "anoint your head with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your head anointed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Also, this speaks of people experiencing disaster and unfortunate times as if they were being imprisoned or trapped. Alternate translation: "evil times are coming upon the children of human beings" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: the children of human beings are ensnared by evil times

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "in the city, people found a poor, wise man" or "a poor, wise man lived in the city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: in the city was found a poor, wise man

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people despise the poor man's wisdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the poor man's wisdom is despised

contextId.occurrenceNote: this can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they do not listen to what he says" or "they do not take his advice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his words are not heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "heard" represents understanding. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is easier to understands the words that wise people speak quietly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The words of wise people spoken quietly are heard better

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Rulers give positions of leadership to fools" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Fools are given leadership positions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they give low positions to successful men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: successful men are given low positions

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those stones can hurt him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: can be hurt by them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the wood may injure him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is endangered by it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "before the snake charmer charms it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: before it is charmed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Fools become weary by their toil" or "Fools feel tired by the work that they do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: wearies them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people shut the doors that lead to the street" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the doors are shut in the street

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone cuts the silver cord" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the silver cord is cut

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone crushes the golden bowl" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the golden bowl is crushed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone shatters the pitcher" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the pitcher is shattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone breaks the water wheel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the water wheel is broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which one shepherd teaches" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: which are taught by one shepherd

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after you have heard everything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after everything has been heard
